result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick A Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick A Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is testing negative and improved on attendance.

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 3 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 9/15/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has begun community service.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case was erroneously calendared for 8/5/2014 at 8:30am, court is down.  Case is adjourned to 8/5/2014 at 1:30 in br. 6.  lms

Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 8/5/2014 at 8:30 am.  aw  Review hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has offered the defendant a DPA.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 6/11/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel needs time to talk with ADA Aleman, and go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 3-31-2014 received and filed. (20 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Debra Patterson 819 N 6th Street Milwaukee WI

Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Dennis Murphy for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Eric Rom-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derrick A Reed in court with Student Intern Trisha Fritz under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Derrick A Reed in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
